message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.HC. 

The paper deals with learning a rotation invariant latent factor model for discovering a set of 3-D bases poses that can characterize the manifold of primitive human motions from a training set of 2-D projected poses obtained from still images taken at various camera angles. This involves techniques from computer vision (to deal with the 2-D projected poses), machine learning (to learn the latent factor model), and graphics (to represent the 3-D bases poses). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves learning a data-driven representation (rather than a hand-designed one), which falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves techniques for activity classification and inference of dynamics from a single frame, which fall under the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.GR (Graphics), respectively. Finally, the paper involves modeling human poses in sports, which falls under the sub-category of cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction).
